diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Drug induced dermatitis v viral exanthem
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's presentation of fever, cough, and chest/back pain led to imaging studies (CTA and echocardiogram) that were unremarkable. Following her discharge, she developed total body itching and a rash leading to peeling skin, alongside nausea and right-sided abdominal pain. The resolution of symptoms after administration of solumedrol, benadryl, and pepcid supports a diagnosis of drug-induced reactions.
